messages: 572f361dafadc97892b4f2331ba145b8 (22:20): anyone familiar with this error, when trying to build "Hello, QT!"? error: 'class QApplication' has no member named 'setMainWidget'
caacdffd7a4aa3937fabe8e185e5165e (22:25): setActiveWindow or setCentralWidget?
caacdffd7a4aa3937fabe8e185e5165e (22:26): use QMainWidget
caacdffd7a4aa3937fabe8e185e5165e (22:27): QMainWidget *a = new QMainWidget(); a->show();
572f361dafadc97892b4f2331ba145b8 (22:27): ohh thanks
cdf4ad80dc66a41f951abab3fde0d774 (22:28): Uh...
572f361dafadc97892b4f2331ba145b8 (22:28): I Was just following the guide. its my first day on Qt
cdf4ad80dc66a41f951abab3fde0d774 (22:28): There is no QMainWidget
572f361dafadc97892b4f2331ba145b8 (22:28): so why does the guide say that!
cdf4ad80dc66a41f951abab3fde0d774 (22:28): That's a Qt3 guide and you're using Qt4.
572f361dafadc97892b4f2331ba145b8 (22:28): the guide is for v3...
cdf4ad80dc66a41f951abab3fde0d774 (22:28): Use the Qt4 tutorials.
572f361dafadc97892b4f2331ba145b8 (22:28): I'm running 4.1.4 . thats the only thing I can think of
572f361dafadc97892b4f2331ba145b8 (22:28): oh; I found a really nice book on Qt3
cdf4ad80dc66a41f951abab3fde0d774 (22:28): That's exactly what it is; setMainWidget is a Qt3 function that's no longer needed in Qt4.
cdf4ad80dc66a41f951abab3fde0d774 (22:29): The Blanchette book, yeah, we know.
cdf4ad80dc66a41f951abab3fde0d774 (22:29): That's where all of the Qt3 programmers in here come from. :P
572f361dafadc97892b4f2331ba145b8 (22:29): do you happen to know of any nice Qt4 - just starting guides?
cdf4ad80dc66a41f951abab3fde0d774 (22:29): Yeah, the one in Assistant or on doc.trolltech.com/4.1 is really good.
cdf4ad80dc66a41f951abab3fde0d774 (22:29): Just work through the tutorial and you'll learn everything you need.
cdf4ad80dc66a41f951abab3fde0d774 (22:30): (Assistant and the site are the same files)
572f361dafadc97892b4f2331ba145b8 (22:30): oh I found a link on Qt's site to a PDF... thats what I was using..
cdf4ad80dc66a41f951abab3fde0d774 (22:30): Yeah, that's the Qt3 stuff. The Qt4 book by the same author hasn't been released in PDF yet, but you can buy the book at a bookstore.
8a9822ff0595044d78204c7678d53294 (22:30): I'm getting a stack of errors from the ui_*.h file generated from the .ui file? any standard newb errors that cause that?
cdf4ad80dc66a41f951abab3fde0d774 (22:30): There IS another Qt4 book online: http://cartan.cas.suffolk.edu/moin/OopDocbook
572f361dafadc97892b4f2331ba145b8 (22:31): oh I was under the impression it wasnt out at all, thats' cool. hey thanks I'll have a look at the online documentation
572f361dafadc97892b4f2331ba145b8 (22:31): and that too :p thanx
caacdffd7a4aa3937fabe8e185e5165e (22:33): sry, qmainwidget* = qmainwindow*
cdf4ad80dc66a41f951abab3fde0d774 (22:35): QMainWindow isn't even the same thing.
cdf4ad80dc66a41f951abab3fde0d774 (22:35): Qt3's setMainWidget means that when the main widget is closed, the app terminates.
cdf4ad80dc66a41f951abab3fde0d774 (22:36): Qt4 doesn't need it because when all top-level widgets are closed, the app terminates.
ea3f8a0223777fdf8d12983027629f14 (22:42): 'skyphyr' pasted "oddd ui_.h errors": http://qtnode.net/pastebin/1045
cdf4ad80dc66a41f951abab3fde0d774 (22:42): Odd, looks like a missing include
cdf4ad80dc66a41f951abab3fde0d774 (22:44): Though I'd need to see the code that's triggering those errors (just a few lines would be enough) to guess at which one.

cdf4ad80dc66a41f951abab3fde0d774 (22:52): Nah, I meant the parts of the ui_*.h file triggering those errors
ea3f8a0223777fdf8d12983027629f14 (22:54): 'skyphyr' pasted "the correct .h file": http://qtnode.net/pastebin/1047
cdf4ad80dc66a41f951abab3fde0d774 (22:56): Aha!
cdf4ad80dc66a41f951abab3fde0d774 (22:56): Heh, that's your problem. "continue" is a reserved word in C++
cdf4ad80dc66a41f951abab3fde0d774 (22:56): Change your button's name.
cdf4ad80dc66a41f951abab3fde0d774 (22:58): Also, looking at the code there, I can once again reaffirm my earlier statement about QMetaObject::connectSlotsByName()

cdf4ad80dc66a41f951abab3fde0d774 (22:58): It connects signals from named objects in the current object to the appropriately-named slots in the object in the parameter list. (For a multiple-inheritance object, you use "this" so both are the same object.)
cdf4ad80dc66a41f951abab3fde0d774 (23:02): Actually, thinking about that more, it's actually even smarter than THAT
cdf4ad80dc66a41f951abab3fde0d774 (23:02): It doesn't use the "current object" because it's a static function -- it doesn't know about the "current object."

cdf4ad80dc66a41f951abab3fde0d774 (23:03): Rather, setupUi() sets the parent for each widget to the parent widget, and the connectSlotsByName function simply connects all named children of the specified object to the appropriate slots.
cdf4ad80dc66a41f951abab3fde0d774 (23:07): skyphyr: Any luck?
8a9822ff0595044d78204c7678d53294 (23:07): yeah - think I got it sorted

8a9822ff0595044d78204c7678d53294 (23:08): I dug through the .ui file - and there was a section where I'd put a combo and a list inside a layout - it had created a widget to put the layout in (didn't notice it) and I couldn't find a way to name it properly - it had called 3 of them all widget
8a9822ff0595044d78204c7678d53294 (23:08): after I changed those names so they were unique it worked
8a9822ff0595044d78204c7678d53294 (23:08): had to edit the .ui file by hand though

ce8a1609cf8d1a408da3cac46365f53e (23:17): ok the problem turns out to be a performance issue with xinerama displays. specifically this app runs extremely slow on xinerama displays, but not on regular X on the same hardware configuration.
